answers.answer: HiYou may need to change your soap or body wash to more organic or hypoallergenic ones. I would recommend Aveeno or Cetaphil when moisturizing or washing the body. These cleansers are mild and bland. Avoid scented and colored body wash as these may contain more abrasive ingredients. You may also need to have a complete work up done here. I suggest that a consult with your internist may also help you. Blood sugar levels may need to be determined. A complete blood count may also help ascertain if an infection is present or not.Recurrent fungal infections may suggest that an underlying disease process may be present(eg Diabetes and allergies).If this is he case, the condition has to be addressed first. Antifungals and topical corticosteroids given during flare ups are needed to control the skin condition.
